caption: The Seine River Cruise was an enchanting way to experience the beauty of Paris from a unique perspective. Gliding along the calm waters of the Seine, I was captivated by the breathtaking views of the city‚Äôs iconic landmarks, each illuminated in its own grandeur.  The cruise offered a perfect blend of relaxation and discovery. Seeing landmarks like the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame Cathedral, and the Louvre from the river provided a new appreciation for their architectural splendor. Passing under the historic bridges, especially Pont Alexandre III, was a delightful experience, as each had its own story and charm.  The ambiance on board was serene and romantic, enhanced by the soft lighting and gentle breeze. For those who choose the evening cruises, the city truly lives up to its name as the ‚ÄúCity of Lights.‚Äù Watching the Eiffel Tower sparkle while floating on the Seine was a moment I‚Äôll never forget.  The staff was courteous, and the audio guide provided fascinating insights into the history and significance of the landmarks. Everything was well-organized, from boarding to the duration of the cruise, making the experience seamless and enjoyable.  I‚Äôd highly recommend the Seine River Cruise to anyone visiting Paris. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a romantic evening, a relaxing escape, or a new way to explore the city, this cruise is a must-do. My only regret is not doing it sooner!

Not a very wide river, per say. But a long one. Vikings sailed up it to conquer. Canals were built to expand it. Bridges are built to cross over it. And dams are built to harness it. Long boats motor it for its beauty, and tourists gaze at it for the French vive la France feeling that is truly this landmark river of Paris, France.
Loved to stroll along the river. Kids‚Äôs eyes were captured by a swan in the river.
There are some amazing sunset views. Would like to go on a boat cruise here one day. In general the area is relatively clean but the water can improve.

The Seine River is the lifeblood of Paris, winding gracefully through the heart of the city and offering some of the most picturesque views. Its banks are lined with iconic landmarks like the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, and the Louvre, making a stroll or boat ride along the river a quintessential Parisian experience. The Seine is not just a beautiful waterway but also a symbol of Paris‚Äôs history and romance, especially at sunset when the city‚Äôs lights reflect off its gentle waters. Whether you're walking along its scenic quays or cruising on a bateau-mouche, the Seine offers a tranquil and unforgettable glimpse of the city‚Äôs magic.

Not knowing much about Paris, pleasant to see this river actually runs through the city and taking a boat ride or tour down this river is a very nice way to see Paris. We used the river boat as a taxi with hop on / off access so it was very convenient to see the major sites in Paris. So many great  picture spots along the river too!

Amazing pedestrianized running path. Over my week in Paris, I ran here many times and got to see so many things. The river keeps the path nice and cool. Got to see so many attractions such as the Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Louvre, and more. Always lots of people out and about but never too busy! Got to see some cool everyday things like trains and a ton of bridges everywhere as well.
The lungs of the city of lights, is this span of water, adds to the beauty of this amazing city, we can never get enough of it, walking along it banks taking it all in
Seine river is the most famous and important river in france.

The Seine River adds vitality to the city. We went in June. Walking parallel to the Seine River gave us a lot of pleasure while doing a city tour in Paris. The air temperature was quite high in those days and you know walking by the river brings a feeling of coolness. It is also possible to take beautiful Paris photos around the Seine River, where there are many bridges and cafes on the side. When you go to Paris, it is certain that your paths will cross somewhere.
One of the must do things in Paris is to get a Seine River cruise to pass by the wonderful sightseeing locations and the stunning bridges.

We went on a riverboat tour to see Paris on the Seine River, so much fun! The tour guide was funny and knowledgeable. We got to drink champagne and just relax and enjoy the night. We got to see the Eiffel Tour at night lit up and it's light show a few times!

If you are in France üá´üá∑ and didn‚Äôt visit Paris that‚Äôs not fair neither to yourself nor to Paris. Once in Paris you have few things you do by hook or by crook. Site seeing on the boat through the river Sein is highly recommended. Whenever you are tired of the city, start walking along the Sein and it won‚Äôt disappoint you. ‚Ä¶

We went for the seine river cruise in the evening , you can enjoy spectacular views of the city , at the time of return can see the illuminated Eiffelüòçüòç Ride starts near Eiffel and end at the same point ‚Ä¶ You can see the famous Notre dame ,Louvre and famous bridges and the beautiful Paris city..

I like how somehow the river Seine gets a rating of 4.5. What is wrong with people? "The area by the river is too cold in the winter. 3 stars." "I heard if you fall In, you get wet. 2 stars." "Love the river but deducting 1 star because it isn't longer."
Beautiful and romantic! Surrounded by countless landmarks so make sure you have a tour map or app and put on a pair of comfy shoe.

Whether cruising down the river on one of the various boat tours or simply enjoying a pic-nic along the banks of the river, this is one of the most romantic and underrated attractions in Paris. I recommend spending an afternoon walking or dining along the banks until the sun sets, then cruising down the river to view Paris at night.

Paris, France's capital, is a major European city and a global centre for art, fashion, gastronomy and culture.  The river Seine crossed the city. The Eiffel Tower and, the 12th-century, Gothic Notre-Dame cathedral, The love bridge can be seen on the bank of the river. The river seine cruise is highly recommended. The couple will have a chance to kiss under the luck bridge and make their wish come true. The ticket is not so expensive. No parking around and public toiles are always nearby.

The Seine River in Paris is an enchanting waterway that gracefully winds its way through the heart of the city, offering a mesmerizing backdrop to the iconic landmarks that adorn its banks. As a symbol of romance and elegance, the Seine provides a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls along its quays, with charming bridges connecting the historic neighborhoods.  The river's charm is heightened by the illuminated monuments that reflect on its surface during the evening, creating a magical ambiance. Taking a boat cruise along the Seine is a must-do experience, allowing visitors to witness Parisian landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame Cathedral, and Louvre Museum from a unique perspective.  The riverbanks host vibrant markets, inviting cafes, and artists capturing the essence of the city with their creations. Whether you're enjoying a riverside picnic or simply savoring the moment on one of the many bridges, the Seine offers a timeless escape from the bustling city life.  In essence, the Seine River is not just a geographical feature but a poetic thread weaving through the fabric of Parisian culture, casting a spell that lingers in the hearts of all who encounter its beauty.

The river Seine is a 777 km long river of France. It is an important commercial waterway of the country as it is connected to English Channel. It is navigable by ocean going vessels and excursion boating offering sightseeing tours on the river banks of Paris. There are 37 bridges within Paris and a dozen more outside the city. The river flows just middle of the city and most of  the famous monuments are located  viz: Notre Dame, The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre Museum etc are situated on the right and left bank of the river.
The weather is cold when taking boat tours in April, but the sceneries along both sides of Seine river are so stunning and romantic üòâ ‚Ä¶
A romantic nice place for a river walk or cruise. Many restaurants along the roads if you are tired or craving a dessert or wine. Many beautiful sights and attractions along the way.
I had a great opportunity to shoot a great photography.
There are many cruises in tourist areas,  Among them, this Seine river cruise was the best.  The boat is comfortable and you can see a lot of famous tourist attractions.
Beautiful scenery while walking along its banks. After having seen this place in so many movies, it was surreal to finally be here.
Good walk in the morning hours, with lots of water point along the way for joggers! Can capture lots of sunrise and supposedly sunset photos from here too üëçüèª ‚Ä¶
We went on a boat to see Paris from the river and it was great. Recommended
River where Parisian Magic Flows! Embarking on a journey along this iconic waterway is like unlocking the soul of Paris itself. A must-do for a truly memorable experience!
Nice river famous for flowing through the city of Paris.
River in central Paris. Plenty of bridges to cross. Many river-side walks.

I loved the view of river seine and the torcardo from Eiffel Tower. It's such an amazing and mesmerising view. The river cruise is a must. The winds that blow over the travel journey of the cruise is such an amazing and cool. It's an amazing experience. There are travel organization that offer both tour of Eiffel and the cruise. Please check the tours as per your convenience and preferences.
What a phenomenal view! You can find a lot of discos, floating restaurants etc. on and around this river. Lookout for the stands of vendors on the banks. Also has several bridges (ponts)on it.
Highly recommend a visit to the Seine River while in Paris

Embarking on a trip along the Seine River in Paris promises a delightful adventure, showcasing the city's charm from a unique perspective. As I embarked on my journey, I couldn't help but notice that while the Seine River has its enchanting allure, it also carries a hint of disappointment due to its occasional cleanliness issues.  While the Seine River serves as a scenic route, winding through the heart of Paris and passing by iconic landmarks, it's important to acknowledge that it can be a little dirty at times. The occasional presence of debris and litter floating on the surface takes away some of the charm and pristine beauty that one might expect from such an iconic waterway. However, it's essential to keep in mind that this is a complex challenge faced by many urban rivers.  Despite the cleanliness concerns, a trip on the Seine River still offers a memorable experience. The river's gentle flow, the picturesque bridges that span its waters, and the opportunity to witness the magnificent architecture of Paris from a unique vantage point all contribute to the allure of the journey. It's an opportunity to immerse oneself in the romantic ambiance of the city and enjoy the scenic views, despite the occasional reminder of the river's cleanliness challenges.

The river Sena is an absolutely marvelous place, this is my favorite city. I simply love Paris, the light, people, meal, chocolate and so on. The streets are so nice, the coffee shops. OMG the bread is delicious...
Although the river is dirty in Paris, there were some ducks chillin with me on the river and that is why this river is great.

The Seine is the major river for which Paris was founded. It divides the city into what is referred to as the Left Bank (south of the river) and the Right Bank (north or the river) and is a place that almost all visitors will see a few times during time spent in the city.  Some of the cities most famous landmarks, churches and museums are located near or directly on the Siene. These include Notre Dame, Mus√©e du Louvre, Mus√©e d'Orsay as well as the Eiffel Tower. Visitors can also take boat rides along the Seine taking in these important and famous sights.  Visitors can cross the Seine by way of numerous bridges including some famous crossings like Pont Alexandre III, Pont Neuf and Pont des Arts. You can also stroll along stretches of the river, enjoy dining at numerous eateries, riverside and gardens along the river.  In the end, you won't need to plan time around the Seine. If you have a busy sightseeing schedule, you'll eventually be on or around the river. just enjoy it then as part of your touring around Paris.
Canal ride on a beautiful evening in June. Paris is magical!
